content: here's my list of resources in draft status:

PaymentReconciliation
AdverseEvent
BiologicallyDerivedProduct
ChargeItem
DeviceUseStatement
EntryDefinition
EventDefinition
ExampleScenario
ImmunizationEvaluation
ImplementationGuideInput
ImplementationGuideOutput

you have about 1hr to review this list
task for FMG: clean up the records of what is approved and what is not
PaymentReconciliation shouldn't be draft.
I do not see an approved resource proposal for it
but yes, it was trial use on the last ballot so it remains trial use

ImmunizationEvaluation is split from Immunization, so has the same status. ResearchStudy and ResearchSubject were renamed from Study and StudyParticipation but are approved. I'm pretty sure TestReport was also approved but it looks like it was not updated. @Anne Wizauer, can you investigate? Nothing else on that list jumps out to me as wrong.
The PA draft stuff looks right.
thx
Another question: this time, for the first time, we have non-realm specific IG guides to publish
I propose to publish them at http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/[code]
people have approximately 15 min (sorry) to comment on that
(as opposed, to, for US-Core: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core)
I'm going to be on a flight during the start of today's call -- I will endeavor to join during my layover from Detroit.
Engaging with the ballot desktop is frustrating because of the byzantine complexity of the ballot process. (which we're contributing too, I know)

FHIR main is:
HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR®) Specification, Release 1 (PI ID: 891) O4

US core is
HL7 FHIR® Profile: US-Core, Release 1 STU Release 2 (PI ID: 1372) D1

PHD is
HL7 FHIR® Implementation Guide: Point-of-care Device (PoCD), Release 1 (PI ID: 1277) I1
I don't even know the difference in effect between I1 and O1
note that according to the ballot, US-Core has 3 versions
Release 1, release 2m, and based on FHIR release 3

we really need to simplify this... but there's things here that I don't understand. Is anyone clever enough to draw a diagram indicating how the main FHIR spec is balloted, and how IGs are balloted that is
a/ compreheneible
b/ usefully related to what the ballot desktop says

(I think I could have a stab at (a) but don't expect to get (b) right and I suspect I've missed something
but it's wrong and hopelessly misleading to call this FHIR R1 draft 4 - crazy

I1 = Informative, ballot 1
O1 = For Comment, ballot 1
Why an IG is being balloted as Informative, I have no clue
This isn't really a ballot desktop issue, it's an artifact naming issue
"Release 1 STU Release 2" is totally out to lunch...
well, the ballot desktop magnifies it, but yes, an artifact naming issue, based on GOM assumptions I guess
so what's the difference in effect between O and I?
It's called "draft 4" because it's the 4th draft ballot we've ever put out. Sequence, apparently, doesn't matter. (Our first 3 drafts were at the very beginning.
Draft ballots don't reallly "count" from ANSI's perspective. An Informative ballot though can be passed and allows something to be submitted to ANSI as a "Technical Report" (whatever that means)

In any case, FMG should have a policy on what artifacts can be balloted on the Informative track (which can be draft or informative) and which must be normative track (draft, STU or normative). I think IGs should always be the latter.
